infodynamics.utils

Class MeasurementDistribution

  • java.lang.Object
    • infodynamics.utils.MeasurementDistribution
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AnalyticMeasurementDistribution, EmpiricalMeasurementDistribution

    public class MeasurementDistribution
extends java.lang.Object

    Structure to hold a distribution of info-theoretic measurements, and a significance value for how an original measurement compared with these.

    While in theory this class could be directly used, it is it's children which are intended to be used.

    Author:
    Joseph Lizier (email, www)

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      double actualValue
      Actual observed value of the measurement
      double pValue
      Probability that surrogate measurement is greater than the observed value.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      protected MeasurementDistribution()
      Allow empty constructor for internal use only when actualValue and pValue will be supplied later
        MeasurementDistribution(double actualValue, double pValue)
      Construct with supplied actual value and p-value for it.

    • Field Detail

      • actualValue

        public double actualValue
        Actual observed value of the measurement

      • pValue

        public double pValue
        Probability that surrogate measurement is greater than the observed value. (Small pValue means that the observed value is highly significant).

    • Constructor Detail

      • MeasurementDistribution

        Allow empty constructor for internal use only when actualValue and pValue will be supplied later

                       double pValue)
        Construct with supplied actual value and p-value for it.
        Parameters:
        actualValue - actual observed value
        pValue - p-value that the surrogate measurement is larger than the observed value
